results.title: Avocets return
results.creator_credit: Anthony Clay, Anthony Bomford and RSPB Film and Video Unit
results.brief_description: This film shows how the Avocet has returned to Britain, as a breeding bird, after a lapse of 100 years. Filmed in Suffolk and Cornwall, it traces the natural history of the Avocet, and the success of the Royal Society for the Protection of Birds in protecting rare species.

results.title: Automatic process control
results.brief_description: Illustrates the advantages to be derived from applying automatic control to a process in a small chemical plant. The four modes of control are discussed: on/off; proportional; proportional with reset; proportional with reset and rate action. An application of instrumentation for continuous process control is explained.
results.description: Illustrates the advantages to be derived from applying automatic control to a process in a small chemical plant. An application of instrumentation for continuous process control is explained.

results.title: Conversion to automatic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates how the automatic transmission operates and discusses the routine procedures the driver should follow for the safe driving of an automatic vehicle.

results.title: Autism: who cares
results.brief_description: Four centres for autistic children in Victoria show how they deal with this problem. Details how they are able to teach the children to eventually integrate into the community. Photographer: Leigh Tilson; Music: Franciscus Henri, Philip Gardner, Audrey Klein.
results.description: Four centres for autistic children in Victoria show how they deal with this problem. Details how they are able to teach the children to eventually integrate into the community. Photographer: Leigh Tilson; Music: Franciscus Henri, Philip Gardner, Audrey Klein.

results.title: The Australian littering quest
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A satirical look at the four contestants hopeful of winning Australia’s littering quest. Describes the various ways they do their littering - including leaving rubbish at a picnic, throwing out “throw-away litter bags”. The judge, a computer, comments on their achievements and announces the winner. Cast includes Tom Paine, Pauline David, Rod Bryer, Guy Doro-Sainter, Monika Tokarski, Ema Ganet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Zalkalns, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 043. Three Directions in Pop Music
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Offers a sample of three trends in recent Australian pop music: the theatrical act of Wendy Saddington and Teardrop; the jug music of the Captain Matchbox Whoopee Band; and the popular rock group Indelible Murtceps.
results.title_for_label: Australian [colour] diary. No. 043. Three Directions in Pop Music

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 027
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine shows the ceremonial opening of Macquarie University in Sydney. A new pattern of study will enable students to participate in a variety of subjects in different faculties. Kathleen Geldard, member of the Australian Ballet Company describes her life of travel, rehearsals and performances.
